ovdesc.p: A user maintained static information table to indicate to the system how and from where the SECURITY MASTER file, LAST PRICE field is to be updated with the latest price.

There has obviously to be a certain amount of interface work to be performed at this point to enable the system to identify the price service indicated, and to pick up the prices correctly. For example, a user may utilise Reuters or Telekurs pricing services. He would therefore give each of these a separate ID and T24 would know where and how to access these particular price feeds and consequently update the SECURITY MASTER record.
Additionally there are indicators within the file to:
1. Illustrate whether the price update is automatic or indeed whether it needs to be done manually.
2. Control the update of past prices and income details on SECURITY.MASTER.

desc.p: This field controls the input of historic prices in SECURITY.MASTER, the three inputs allowed are YES, NO or OVERRIDE, the default value is YES.
If the field is YES then a user will be able to input a price in the past for any security that is linked to this PRICE.UPDATE code.
If the field is NO then a user will not be able to input a price in the past for any security that is linked to this PRICE.UPDATE code.
If the field is OVERRIDE then a user will be able to input a price in the past for any security that is linked to this PRICE.UPDATE code, but this will produce an override message.
An abbreviated description of the PRICE.UPDATE

This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the description of the PRICE.UPDATE method in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the language in which the description is to be entered.
3 to 15 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character must be alpha) characters Multi language field (Mandatory Input)
Unique reference which identifies the PRICE.UPDATE record.
1-5 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory Input)
Specifies whether Price.Updates to the SECURITY.MASTER will be automatic or manual.
Y = Yes (automatic), or N(O) = No (manual). (Mandatory Input)

This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the description of the PRICE.UPDATE method in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the language in which the description is to be entered.
3 to 35 type AA (alphanumeric, first character must be alpha) characters. Multi language field (Mandatory Input)
This field controls the input of historic income details in SECURITY.MASTER, the three inputs allowed are YES, NO or OVERRIDE, the default value is YES.
If the field is YES then a user will be able to input income details in the past for any security that is linked to this PRICE.UPDATE code.
If the field is NO then a user will not be able to input income details in the past for any security that is linked to this PRICE.UPDATE code.
If the field is OVERRIDE then a user will be able to input income details in the past for any security that is linked to this PRICE.UPDATE code, but this will produce an override message.
